TextBody:
Hello Glenda,

Thank you for your time and patience on this issue and I am glad that we were able to get your issue resolved for you. 
The following is a summary of the ticket for your records.

Issue:
NEA database cleanup job is not functioning properly.

Resolution:
The issue was resolved when we moved to a new server and redeployed to cleanup any corruption that may have existed in the old environment.

At this time I will be closing your ticket out for you. This case can be re-opened at any time if any related issues return. 
Please feel free to reach out to the Netwrix team if you have any additional questions or would like assistance with any issues. Following this email, you will receive an automated confirmation that the case has been closed.
You will also receive a survey link, it would help us greatly to improve our support service if you could provide any feedback that you may have regarding your experience with this case.

Thank you,
Ian Ranstrom
Senior Technical Support Engineer
__________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy
6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com

Hello Glenda,

Thank you for taking the time to meet today.

Today we:
Looked into why some SQL servers are not allowing login.
We found that one server was not listening on the correct ports and we fixed this.
We are still looking into why the remote logins are failing when the work locally.

Hello Glenda,

Thank you for taking the time to meet today.

Today we:
Configured the Active Directory jobs to run on a schedule as they appear to be working as expected.
Migrated and configured the SQL server job to run.

I also looked into the AD permissions analyzer and it looks like you are not licensed for the module. Its possible at some point there was a trial licence or something to that effect. I've let your account manager know that you would like to use that module again and he will work with you and Tim to get that licensed so we can configure it again.

Our next steps are:
You will:
Prepare a new acitivy monitor server for migration.
Below are the requirements for the Activity monitor server so we can migrate it off of your 2016 server.

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/ActivityMonitor_7.1/page/Content/ActivityMonitor/Requirements/Overview.htm


Please use this link to schedule our next meeting at your convenience
https://nwxcorp.my.salesforce-sites.com/cts?Id=sYBGCf8aZiuZdy30Ns4.U7uTRscpipUcOWH5Rf8vG1I-Z&MeetingID=2VUHAd62a.I_H3yXEvIHiZDp4G6BkLgRbgG4hMr4.tE-Z

Hello Glenda,

Thank you for taking the time to meet today.

Today we:
Checked on errors generated during the file system scans. No immediately alarming errors are present and most seem to point to a know access issue with a new server.
Migrated the database and log files on the database server to the correct drives and verified access.
Verified that AIC is seeing information and could still access information after DB migration.
Setup Active Directory job, we expect this to fail as we were not able to fully configure it but this will help point us to any possible problems that may exist.
Our next steps are:
You will:
Upload the log file from the File System job to the ticket.
I will:
Verify steps needed to migrate the temdb to the correct location.


Please use this link to schedule our next meeting at your convenience
https://nwxcorp.my.salesforce-sites.com/cts?Id=IOuBFeI_hwIS4nRzR.VslfRKmx9TCiwJJzCy_doCfxE-Z&MeetingID=oN5Qbb1GjjBZfxJx0RaTyVQ8Kq6USR255la9sjaYlXw-Z

Hello Glenda,

Thank you for taking the time to meet today.

Today we:
Installed NEA and created a new database.
Configured host discovery for production and DR, setup scheduled scans for host discovery, and started host discovery jobs.
We verified that hosts were coming in and SQL database servers were populating appropriatly.

We also launched an initial ADI scan and File sysem schema create job to ensure the database and AD scanning were working as expected.
Our next steps are:
You will:
Check the hosts tomorrow after the next scan is scheduled to run to make sure it looks good and the servers you expect are showing up.
I will:
Send you a new meeting invite to prepare for the next setup task and review the documented jobs to prepare for setup.


Please use this link to schedule our next meeting at your convenience
https://nwxcorp.my.salesforce-sites.com/cts?Id=HbdaxqdA8geK9k2w_pKXcIQS2gjeDX1JEAa55hy1RV4-Z&MeetingID=Y8w0fO7RvEerTN1D52XIqWVP_HF1mbZEsYgLBc8_430-Z

Subject: RE: File System Activity - Data Retention [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Idmoq:ref ]

Hello Glenda,

Thank you for taking the time to meet today.

Today we:
Looked into the FSAC data not displaying properly in the reports and AIC.
We verified that NAM was running correctly and that the retention and scan settings were not creating a scenario where we may be missing data.

We checked the database to see what data was present, we could see data going back well beyond the 90 day retention policy, and as recent as the 11th of December.
The data from the 11th though was not matching what was expected, we saw 4 hosts reporting file system activity, but there should be more than 4 being monitored.

I do have some suspicion that the data retention is somehow tied to the host cleanup that is also becoming problematic. We determined that since you wanted to upgrade the OS on your NEA and SQL systems, we could deploy a parallel system to get a clean set of data. This will allow you to work with the product and get the data, or will help narrow down the possible failure points we may be experiencing with a clean setup.

Below is the documents that detail the requirements for a new SQL server and a new NEA server for our parallel test.

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Requirements/Overview.htm

Our next steps are:
You will:
Provision new systems to run a clean SQL database and a clean NEA/AIC setup.
Please get these systems ready and we can assist with the deployment of the applications.
I will:
Once the servers are ready, I will assist with deployment and setup to get a new baseline of the FSAC to ensure that the data being collected is correct and not being impacted by any previous settings are instance of NEA that may be affecting the current system.



Thank you,
Ian Ranstrom
